main event: A disc-shaped, silver-gray, luminous object approximately 40-50 feet in diameter was sighted by a State of Illinois Security Officer and a State of Illinois Conservation Officer.
interesting points: The object was observed moving at an estimated speed of 3,000 miles per hour.
The object made a sharp turn at a high rate of speed, changing direction from southwest to northeast.
The object was observed for approximately 3 minutes.
The weather conditions were clear with some wind, and no unusual weather phenomena were observed.
The object had a definite circular outline and was described as luminous.
witnesses: State of Illinois Security Officer and State of Illinois Conservation Officer
